description: At some cafes, staff said Singaporeans in their 20s and 30s now make up about 70 per cent of patrons. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Cafe-hopping in JB increasingly popular among young S'poreans
title_page: Cafe-hopping in JB increasingly popular among young S'poreans | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE - Cafes in Johor Bahru are now a booming business as young Singaporeans flock across the border just to visit them.
Cafe hopping, which involves visiting multiple cafes, has become an increasingly popular activity since the border reopened in June.
